com.quinsoft.zeidon

Class ZeidonException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.quinsoft.zeidon.ZeidonException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenkeyLockException, HiddenAttributeException, HiddenCursorException, InvalidAttributeConversionException, InvalidAttributeValueException, InvalidComparisonException, InvalidTaskException, InvalidViewException, KeyValidator.KeyValidationError, MaxCardinalityException, NullCursorException, ObjectConstraintException, OutOfScopeException, PessimisticLockingException, RequiredAttributeException, RequiredEntityMissingException, SubobjectValidationException, TemporalEntityException, UnknownApplicationException, UnknownAttributeDefException, UnknownEntityDefException, UnknownLodDefException, ZeidonDbException

    public class ZeidonException
extends RuntimeException
    The base exception class for all Zeidon-specific exceptions. This class has the following conveniences over regular exceptions: - The exception message can be initialized using String.format parsing. For example, new ZeidonException( "Line number: %d, text = %s", line, msg ); - Message text can be added to the exception after it's been instantiated. This allows code to catch an exception, add more information, and rethrow it. See appendMessage() and prependMessage(). - The logic is smart enough to ignore duplicate messages. - Checked exceptions can be easily wrapped by ZeidonException using wrapException(). This will keep the call stack the same as the wrapped exception.
    Author:
    DG
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • prependMessage

        public static ZeidonException prependMessage(Throwable t,
                                             String format,
                                             Object... args)
        Returns a ZeidonException with additional information added to the message of exception 't'. If 't' is a ZeidonException then the text is added and returned. Otherwise a new ZeidonException is created that wraps the original exception and attempts to keep the same message/stack trace.
        Parameters:
        t -
        format -
        args -
        Returns:

      • wrapException

        public static ZeidonException wrapException(Throwable t)
        Wraps 't' with a ZeidonException and changes the call stack for the ZeidonException to match 't'. This is mostly used to re-throw checked exceptions as unchecked ones.
        Parameters:
        t -
        Returns:
